result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy G Sandlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.
Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Timothy G Sandlin in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest, with repeater enhancer dismissed.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Repeater enhancer dismissed.  Sentencing recommendations argued by State and Defense.  Defendant made statement to court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days jail, with Huber.  and $443.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Submit DNA sample.  Jail start on 5-6-16 at 7:00 pm.  2 days credit.   1:36/1:53
